description:
Our computational challenges are so big, complex and unique we can't just purchase off-the-shelf hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Your team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Camera Hardware Engineer, you design and build the systems that are the heart of the world's largest and most powerful computing infrastructure. You develop from the lowest levels of circuit design to large system design and see those systems all the way through to high volume manufacturing. Your work has the potential to shape the machinery that goes into our cutting-edge data centers affecting millions of Google users.

The Camera Hardware team inside the Imaging and Vision group is responsible for developing camera hardware for all Google’s consumer products. As a Camera Hardware Engineer, you'll drive definition, design, development, and integration of high-quality camera components and modules into all Google’s consumer products. You will have the responsibility of entire lifecycle of project, including both technology and product development.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Optics, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, a related field or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in one of the following key imaging technology areas: optics and optical design, mechanical and opto-mechanical design, analog and mixed signal design, or imaging algorithm and image signal processing.

Preferred qualifications:

  • PhD in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Optics, Mechanical Engineering, Physics, or a related field.
  • Experience in statistics and data analysis using MATLAB, Python, JMP, Minitab, or other similar software.
  • Experience in high volume consumer product development and manufacturing test and qualification.
  • Excellent communication, project management, and leadership skills.
responsibilities:
• Work with vendors to advance camera component and/or module for our products.
  • Work with internal and external teams to define camera specifications such as the lens and camera module.
  • Devise testing plans for controlling camera quality.
  • Work with Imaging Firmware Engineers and Tuning Engineers to properly calibrate the camera.
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams on camera system integration, image tuning, and camera related software.
title: Camera Hardware Engineer, Consumer Hardware
